title: Haiti Kidnapping: What Happened to the U.S. Missionaries and When Were They Released?
sub_head: After two months of being held hostage, missionaries are released unharmed by a gang
body:
A group of mostly American missionaries kidnapped two months ago in Haiti have all been released unharmed. Two were freed on Nov. 21, three more on Dec. 6 and the remaining 12 on Dec. 16.
A Haitian gang kidnapped the group in broad daylight near the capital of Port-au-Prince on Oct. 16 and threatened to kill them if ransom wasnâ€™t paid. The group of 16 Americans and one Canadian included seven women and five children, and belongs to Ohio-based Christian Aid Ministries, a charity set up by Amish and Mennonites.
